{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the point used as termination of Root canal procedure. From the provided documents, Root-end induction procedure was used to treat a nonvital tooth with an open apex. This suggests that the point of termination is likely the apical constriction or the apical foramen, as these are common points at which root canal procedures terminate.
